column1: I solemnly swear that in all things appertaining to the trial of the impeachment of Donald John Trump President of the United States now pending I will do impartial justice according to the Constitution and laws: so help me God. https://t.co/N2rTqGUKOh

Senators swore an oath to support & defend the Constitution. That includes protecting the First Amendment.   We must reverse these unreasonable new restrictions & give reporters the access they need to keep the American people informed.   https://t.co/il8AzQnh7X

Our military uses outdated & ineffective tools to block sharing of child pornography on its servers.  @lisamurkowski & I worked together to get our END Network Abuse Act to the president's desk.  Read about how our new law will fight child exploitation ⬇️  https://t.co/y9k7GTOmrK

Raising the minimum age for buying tobacco to 21 will reduce the number of young smokers & save lives. My bill which is set to become law this week is a victory for public health.  📺 hear more from @HawaiiNewsNow https://t.co/GXmzzGTWkQ

Washington is growing more heated & partisan by the day but my responsibility is to legislate. Especially when things get hard we have to dig in work across the aisle & do our jobs.   I’m proud to have earned bipartisan support for my four bills set to become law soon. https://t.co/Wwbeo5SP3m

Emergency alerts save lives – so we have to get it right.  The federal government is always the first to know of a missile threat so they should be responsible for telling us.  Set to be signed into law my bill will do that & keep our families safe.  https://t.co/T2XyUhhcwI

Rising sea levels & more frequent severe storms are a threat to Hawaii's homes businesses & infrastructure. That's why @SenDemsClimate held a hearing on disaster resilience so we can make sure our communities are prepared & can rebuild even stronger. https://t.co/pjRC8ZeJhJ

Today the House of Representatives took the historic step of introducing Articles of Impeachment against President Trump for abusing the power of his office and obstructing Congress. https://t.co/wJCBO4Vt9p

We have a long way to go before the nene is completely recovered but delisting is an important milestone.  Thanks to the federal programs state agencies & the many environmental groups & volunteers who are working to save our iconic state bird.  https://t.co/nFCUwSN2uc

Federal regulators are finally starting to pay attention to the risks climate change poses to our financial system.   Yesterday @federalreserve Vice Chair Randal Quarles confirmed that the Fed is looking to join the global group of regulators tackling climate financial risks 👇 https://t.co/BTnKarWyhc
My statement on the shooting incident at Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam: https://t.co/ZPkypK3NJE

I asked Julie Brill of @Microsoft if people have any idea that online companies exploit their personal information by hiding behind complex legal loopholes.  She said no.  That’s unacceptable – people deserve a federal privacy law that protects them not Big Tech’s profits. https://t.co/Vt2baoVacC

Hawaii will receive $26M in new federal disaster relief funding from @HUDgov to help us recover from the historic storms in 2018 Hurricane Lane and the eruption of Kilauea.  📺 @HawaiiNewsNow https://t.co/uQ6xXuXqXd
Congratulations on today’s promotion of Navy Commander Scott Bresnahan who served for more than a decade in Hawaii. We're grateful for your leadership & service. https://t.co/WxrFleKmaT

Just as doctors & lawyers are expected to protect & responsibly use the personal data they hold online companies should be required to do the same.  Our bill will help make sure that when websites & apps collect personal information it won’t be abused.  https://t.co/tcCqfaAwUa

📣 $26M in new federal disaster relief funding from @HUDgov is headed to Hawaii  This grant is a huge help as we recover from historic storms in 2018 Hurricane Lane & the eruption of Kilauea — and I'll keep fighting for more funding at every opportunity.  https://t.co/M34o2Nv3Kt

Free WiFi is coming to 7 Hawaii County parks.  From business to health care to education internet access is critical lifeline for every community. We'll keep fighting to expand access for Hawaii #HINews  https://t.co/vaEd9AoPmr

When it comes to online privacy we need to establish rights & responsibilities:  👉 rights for consumers who share personal information online 👉 responsibilities for companies who collect manage & transmit data  Read more about our new bill 👇  https://t.co/HiPZfnkj1p

You shouldn’t have to worry about losing your job just because you need a break to eat a meal or use the restroom or tend to a medical need.  My new bill protects the right to address basic needs on the job without losing pay or threat of termination. #DignityOfWork https://t.co/ZznM6bmhKk

Everyone deserves access to quality affordable health care regardless of where they live.   Our new bipartisan bill will help identify areas where there aren't enough general surgeons so we can address this crisis.
Hawaiʻi has a 42% shortage of general surgeons -- meaning too many don't have access to the care they need. Here's how the general surgeon shortage affects each county ⬇️ https://t.co/X7JlHB6Cun

My new bill will protect her right to address this medical condition without losing any money from her paycheck. It will also ensure that every worker has the right to bathroom breaks & meal breaks #DignityOfWork https://t.co/PixBDwjPLG
Anna can’t afford to lose the pay but she also can’t not take the breaks when she need to.  That isn’t right.

For medical reasons Anna had to get an accommodation for additional bathroom breaks.   Even after obtaining a note from her physician her company refuses to pay her for taking these medically-required breaks — reducing her already low pay of $11.40/hour.

THREAD: Anna Flemmings is a customer service representative at a call center in Hattiesburg Mississippi.  Anna helps people access affordable health care through the Center for Medicaid and Medicare Services.

When we let companies use our personal information we should be able to trust that it will be protected & won’t be used to harm us.  Our new bill lays out a set of strong data privacy rights & provides the tools needed to hold Big Tech accountable.  https://t.co/29l8RwleQM

Too many workers don’t have the right to use the restroom eat a meal or tend to medical conditions while working long shifts.   My new bill will ensure all workers are treated with dignity & protect the right to address needs during the workday. #DignityOfWork https://t.co/X0G7BCWpf0

Federal funding for new buses on Kauai & Hawaii Island means that those who depend on buses to get to school or work every day will continue to have an affordable way to get around.  📺 more from @KHONnews https://t.co/QSDD98JvZm

$6.5M in federal funding for new buses is headed to Kauai & Hawaii Island 🚌  This big investment means that residents who depend on buses to get to school or work every day will continue to have an affordable way to get around #HINews  https://t.co/1oqdFfEdX0
The @DeptofDefense is expanding access to military commissaries & exchanges to more veterans & caregivers in Hawai‘i.  Here's what you need to know ⬇️ https://t.co/K1ds50VgXy

.@SenDemsClimate spoke with leaders from low-income communities & communities of color who are facing the worst of the climate crisis. Their leadership is integral to developing climate solutions.  Thanks @SenDuckworth for leading an important discussion on #EnvironmentalJustice https://t.co/gTt0rpUtE5

Trump's White House made a baseless claim that providing more shelters incentivizes homelessness – a claim that their own nominee for Deputy Secretary of @HUDgov couldn't even defend.  Watch our exchange below 👀 https://t.co/eYXVKoiBvs
This bill would require the Fed to do its job and make sure our largest financial institutions are resilient to climate risks to avoid a financial crisis.  https://t.co/ucidqR1Tt6
Financial stability is part of the Fed’s mandate and regulators in other countries are already working to quantify and manage climate risks. Why is the Fed lagging behind?
Banks face the risk of direct losses from climate change not just in the distant future but now. But like the housing bubble in 2007 our regulators are ignoring these risks.
Climate change lowers labor productivity stresses farm output hurts property values and disrupts supply chains. No part of our economy will be spared.

Climate change is a major risk we are ignoring. It is increasing severe floods and wildfires driving sea level rise and dangerous heat waves. These events are happening more often and causing more damage. These events hurt the economy.
When we ignore risks in our financial system we risk a crisis that harms the whole economy and wipes out household wealth as we saw in 2008.
THREAD: Here’s how our new climate stress test bill can help preserve our financial future ⬇️

The West Hawaii Community Health Center provides affordable & accessible health care services to thousands of people who might not otherwise receive care.  This new funding will provide the resources needed to continue serving Hawaii Island families.  https://t.co/NEJrRdtl2W
We're urging the U.S. Marine Corps to listen to community concerns & rethink its plan to build a massive seawall on Ewa Beach.   📺 more from @HawaiiNewsNow https://t.co/AsFGvXSMv0

We have a surgeon shortage crisis in Hawaii. My bipartisan bill will help us better understand where the shortages exist so that we can work to bring more surgeons to those communities.   We must ensure everyone can get the care they need — regardless of where they live. https://t.co/QIMQ4lah53

🚨From the IPCC: “The conclusion is inescapable: The impacts of climate change on the ocean are well underway. Unless we take very serious action very soon these impacts will get worse — much much worse.”🚨   We need climate action now. https://t.co/cgl81Xax0u

Under the pretense of an "emergency" the president is raiding $3.6B from 127 critical military projects and programs to build a wall that the American people don't want.   I'm heading to the floor to vote to end this fake emergency. Democrats and Republicans alike should too.

People living in coastal cities are already feeling the effects of climate change.  We need climate action now to get them the resources they need to defend themselves against the crisis. https://t.co/HcFRYbugQP
Climate change is a planetary emergency and the Senate Democrats won’t wait any longer to take action. Watch the first hearing of our @SenDemsClimate Committee https://t.co/Y2TpgM4ito
This morning I joined @MorningJoe to discuss our first hearing and the work our committee is doing to take bold climate action.

The cost of inaction on climate is increasingly higher than the cost of action – and that’s why @SenateDems aren’t waiting any longer to move forward. We formed a new committee to address the climate crisis. https://t.co/SNb5tvcgzf

Too often the conversation around what to do about climate change gets stuck at the individual level. We can’t save the planet just by canceling our vacations. Citizens should demand solutions that meet the scale of the problem. https://t.co/0j5TCLZ9Lq
Mahalo to @KauaiCoffeeCo @BICandies @HawaiianHostInc @mauibrewingco @KingsHawaiian @KoloaRum & @KonaBrewingCo for bringing some much-needed aloha to the Capitol.
Great catching up with state and county leaders at #HawaiiOnTheHill. This event shows Washington how much our state has to offer. https://t.co/ufht40sXak

Today we’re launching the Special Committee on the Climate Crisis. The members of this committee are all leading on climate in different ways and that is going to be the foundation for our success. With this committee we can build a coalition capable of bold action. https://t.co/opIAcbmy88

That’s why I’m reintroducing the #DebtFreeCollege Act. My bill will bring states back to the table and leverage federal dollars to reinvest in public education and help people cover the full cost of college. WATCH LIVE: https://t.co/dLajfELh7n

The full cost of college – including books room and board and supplies -- is more than twice as much as tuition. If we are going to be serious about solving the student loan debt crisis we need to focus on the real cost to students and their families.
